title: Remove Menu page from navigation and make Order the default home page

requirements.summary: Change the default route so that navigating to '/' redirects to '/order' instead of '/menu'
acceptanceCriteria: Opening the app at the root URL '/' takes the user directly to the Order page.
No redirect to '/menu' occurs on initial load.

file_operations.description: Update the root index route to redirect to '/order' instead of '/menu'. Modify the IndexRoute configuration to use navigate: { to: '/order' } so that the default landing page is the Order page.

requirements.summary: Remove the 'Menu' tab/link from the bottom navigation bar so only 'Order' and 'Reports' tabs are visible
acceptanceCriteria: The bottom navigation bar no longer shows a 'Menu' tab.
Only 'Order' and 'Reports' tabs are present in the navigation.
The active tab highlighting still works correctly for the remaining tabs.

file_operations.description: Remove the Menu navigation link from the tab bar. Keep only the Order and Reports links. Ensure active route highlighting continues to work correctly for the two remaining tabs.

requirements.summary: Keep the Menu Management page accessible to admin users via a route but remove it from main navigation
acceptanceCriteria: The '/menu' route still renders the MenuManagement page for admin users.
Non-admin users cannot reach the menu management page through the navigation UI.
Admin users have at least one way to navigate to Menu Management (e.g., a link in the header when isAdmin is true).

file_operations.description: Add an admin-only Menu Management link in the app header that appears when the user has admin privileges. Use the useAdminRole hook to check if the current user is an admin, and conditionally render a link to '/menu' in the header navigation area. This provides admin users access to Menu Management without exposing it in the main bottom navigation.
